title:
Monolithic overlapping Schwarz preconditioners for nonlinear finite
  element simulations of laser beam welding processes
authors: Tommaso Bevilacqua and Axel Klawonn and Martin Lanser and Adam Wasiak
abstract:
Highly resolved finite element simulations of a laser beam welding process
are considered. The thermomechanical behavior of this process is modeled with a
set of thermoelasticity equations resulting in a nonlinear, nonsymmetric saddle
point system. Newton's method is used to solve the nonlinearity and suitable
domain decomposition preconditioners are applied to accelerate the convergence
of the iterative method used to solve all linearized systems. Since a onelevel
Schwarz preconditioner is in general not scalable, a second level has to be
added. Therefore, the construction and numerical analysis of a monolithic,
twolevel overlapping Schwarz approach with the GDSW (Generalized
Dryja-Smith-Widlund) coarse space and an economic variant thereof are presented
here.
